Now this game is a great game, even if it is old and because it has multiple modes I will make different sections for each one.  Singleplayer: The Story in this game was very unique and catching. I enjoyed it alot more than any other story of any other Call of Duty. The Controls where easy and the voice acting was great! The only annoying thing was that the default fov is 65. But if you look around on the internet you will find a guide that helps you changing it into 90. The Most annoying thing by far was that for some reason it didn't read my save file proper and after restarting the game I had to restart also the story. But after all the problems have been fixed I could enjoy the singleplayer like no other. It was worth going through that as I really felt some of the characters growing to my heart!  Zombiemode: The Zombiemode in this game is alot different from the second, it is harder and also in my opinion alot scarier than Number 2. If you happen to play on your own you can have 90 fov but as soon as you play online and/or with your friends it will stay on 65 fov. Which I find personally annoying. But it is still a good game mode to play in singleplayer mode. It is alot of fun.  Multiplayer: Unlike other Call of Dutys this game has an actual Serverbrowser where you can search for a server of any kind to join. Most of them do not have any admins anymore but it is still alot of fun to play on them. In the Multiplayer mode you can change and keep your FOV from 65 up to 90.   All in all this game is amazing, the graphics are still good looking and I had no problems running it on the highest setting. Although there is one thing I would like to mention. If you are german you will get the cut version because of Nazis and the Hackenkreuz. I do not know how much they cut out but I am pretty sure it must have been quiet a bit. I recommend you getting this game uncut from a key website. You will have the same fun as anybody else for a cheaper price!  Which is one of my last points. This game has a great singleplayer, story and zombie mode. But for the fact on how old this game is and that hardly anybody still plays the multiplayer (compared to more newer cods anyways) I recommend to get this game on sale.

One of the most classic CoDs out there and one of the last good ones too. I remember playing this game on the 360 the year it came out and enjoyed the multiplayer and zombies, although as time progressed I ended up forgetting about it and sold my 360. I recently decided to buy it again for the PC off of another website for about $10 since it's still overly expensive on steam and these are my thoughts on it:   CAMPAIGN   Since I never got to finishing the campaign on the Xbox I decided to play it again and actually finished it. Graphics are still pretty impressive for a 5 year old game. The campaign provided amazingly fun gameplay and a very engaging story that kept me playing until the end; I was also really surprised by how intriguing the story was and it was definitely worth the play time I put into completing it. I'm sure a lot of people new to the game will enjoy it as much as I did.    MULTIPLAYER   Multiplayer is enjoyable, although to some it may look like it's just been completely dominated by hardcore game modes which some people might find out of their comfort zone, although softcore game modes still exist it just takes a bit of searching for. Most of the community is mature since most of the CoD kiddies are found on console so no need to worry about 9 year olds screaming into their turtlebeaches.   ZOMBIES   The Zombies game mode is still very enjoyable especially with others and surprisingly it's not that hard to find an online lobby(for me at least). You can also play with your friends which I strongly recommend doing unless you're hardcore and like going solo. If you plan on buying this for the zombies you should also pick up the Rezzurection DLC since they only really give you 3 zombies maps in the base game which can get boring after awhile for some people.  Overall I'd give this game a 9/10 and it was worth the amount I paid. I'd recommend this to any fan of the classic CoDs such as CoD4, WaW etc. or anyone who is a fan of FPS games and/or shooting zombies.

Oh man, I really don't want to do this, but sadly I must give Black Ops a negative review. Mind you I like this game. As a game it's top notch and worth playing. However I'm quite annoyed at the actual PC version of this game.   The problems stem from the fact that there's NO niceties and at least one VERY big flaw. First the opening interface is HORRIBLE on PC. You literally MUST have a keyboard for the game to work. Even a mouse won't allow you to use the menu efficently. So trying to play this game with just a controller is a horrible experience. In addition even though controllers work in game, they don't work well. You can get all the functionality you expect in game, but on the pause menu the controller only works with the pause button. You can't select anything with out a mouse or keyboard.   Even when the controller works in game, it doesn't work out of game, so the main menu still doesn't work, and will require a keyboard and a mouse if you are ever use big picture mode.   That isn't a big problem, however the interface all over feels like a interface from 2005, even in a 2010 game this is outdated, but again I could live with this.   However there's two major issues I have. First the game does try to cloud save something but does a horrible job of it (nothing is stored in the cloud) but the worse problem is if you somehow run out of memory as you play the game (not impossible) the game will actually delete your save data. I ended up losing my entire progress because of this when nearing the end of the game, a second time.   I mean seriously? I had a save game that was quite far, and then there was a dialog telling me the game was out of memory, and when I quit to fix the problem, my save game was wiped.   Black Ops was one of the best Call of Duty games in years, but I'd recommend a console copy if you want to play it now for the single player. The PC version is ok, but definitely showing it's age. Of course if you want mouse and keyboard you'll have to play on the PC, but that'd be the only reason I'd recommend playing this game,   It's not a bad game, but damn it, the game should be far better than these problems.

Treyarch's surprisingly good campaign set in the Cold War.   Built on the Modern Warfare 2 engine, Black Ops takes a similar approach to the gameplay style - that is, very different from the older Call of Duty titles - while fixing most of the things that Modern Warfare 2 did wrong, adding a bunch of new things and moving the setting to the Cold War. That is basically it in a nutshell.  Before playing through the campaign for the first time, I was pretty sceptic about it, but needless to say it blew those bad expectations right away pretty quickly. It is packed with action at every single step and tells the story in a way that sucks you in like a high-wattage vacuum cleaner, which really was a pleasant surprise from Treyarch as I was expecting something more along the lines of World at War. I would recommend playing through it if you have not done so yet, it is not going to eat that much of your time since it is, after all, a Call of Duty, and there were quite a few memorable moments to justify it.  As I mentioned earlier, the multiplayer comes with many improvements over Modern Warfare 2. The entire game feels more balanced, requires more skill rather than allowing you to grenade-launch your way to victory, and while the killstreak rewards can feel overpowered at times, it is nowhere as bad as it used to be. There is also an in-game currency system used to purchase guns and custom emblems - I, myself, have not managed to find the actual purpose of it because you still have to level up to actually purchase the items, but it is there nonetheless. And, of course, the returning Zombies mode makes for loads of fun as well.  Overall, it is a good game, and if currently on sale, I would not hesitate buying it.

When I first heard of Black Ops, I was afraid that it would be a shoddy MW2 ripoff. While it retains much of the MW2 formula, the changes are a fresh breath of air.  PROS: +One of the best stories in Call of Duty history, with plausible realism. +A great single-player campaign full of intrigue, questions, answers, and glorious setpieces. +Collected intel can be viewed to learn more about the story, as well as provide a prologue and epilogue to the story. +Damn fine score. +Refined multiplayer with a level-cap closer to CoD 4, so less grinding to prestige. +Highly balanced multiplayer. There's maybe one or two over-powered guns. +Customizable emblems! +Bots! (Only for Team Deathmatch and Free for All, though) +Nazi Zombies! +Self-reviving in SP zombies. +New and fun Nazi Zombies maps in some setpieces quite a bit cooler than WaW's locations. +DLC for WaW zombies maps in Black Ops. +Feels similar to MW2 without going over-the-top. +Dedicated servers! +Zork!  CONS: -A number of mediocre to downright terrible maps in multiplayer and zombies (Shangri-La comes to mind). -In multiplayer, those few overpowered guns are nearly everywhere. It's hard to find a game without less than three players using said guns. -Worse graphics than in MW2. -Killstreaks don't count towards further killstreaks. -Multiplayer uses 'CODpoints,' a currency used to buy everything you want to unlock, even if you have the level cap for it. So you won't be able to feasably build a half-decent custom emblem until the late part of multiplayer.  A really fine game, and a welcome addition to the Call of Duty lineup.
